pages.text: The strongest material you could find so far was Netherite. However, repairing $(item)Netherite Armor$() had the disadvantage that it was more expensive than making the armor itself. In addition, the protection decreased with every scratch. All this is less problematic when the armor simply $(italic)cannot$() be damaged.$(br2)$(italic)Never wilt, stone blossom.
The Bedrock Helmet comes with $(bold)Projectile Protection V$().
The Bedrock Chestplate comes with $(bold)Protection V$().
The Bedrock Leggings come with $(bold)Blast Protection V$().
The Bedrock Boots come with $(bold)Fire Protection V$().
